titles.title: Permitting the remains of the late United States Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol.
Permitting the remains of the late United States Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans to lie in honor in the rotunda of the Capitol.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Without objection, the Chair laid before the House H. Con. Res. 27.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: This concurrent resolution authorizes the use of the Capitol rotunda on April 13, 2021, for the lying in honor of the remains of the late U.S. Capitol Police Officer William F. Evans.
